_header: My love she mourneth / For me for me
Note:
Cf. 3637 and 5886; for a religious adaptation cf. 6551. Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 1057.
Subjects: love, divine and human; love, of Christ; Christ, love toward
_description: Defend all true lovers — eleven 6-line tail-rhyme stanzas

BLAdd31922.First Lines: My loue she morneth for memy loue sche morneth for meAlas pour hart sen we departmorne ye no more for me for me…
BLAdd31922.Last Lines: …And in especyall from iebardyseall my loue þat mornyth for me
BLAdd31922.Note: Words and notation repeated for further singing parts.
